intro: Asterolinon adoense, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Asterolinon adoense is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
